javadoc:
Interface to define methods to manage data and tools for users working on a
 particular effort. Project represents the container object for users, data,
 and tools to work together.

methods.javadoc: Convenience method to get the name of this project.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Convenience method to get the name of this project.

methods.javadoc: Get the project locator for this project.
methods.name: getProjectLocator
methods.comment: Get the project locator for this project.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the project manager of this project.
@return the project manager of this project.
methods.name: getProjectManager
methods.comment: Returns the project manager of this project.

return.comment: the project manager of this project.

methods.javadoc: Return the tool manager for this project.
methods.name: getToolManager
methods.comment: Return the tool manager for this project.

methods.javadoc: Return the tool services for this project.
methods.name: getToolServices
methods.comment: Return the tool services for this project.

methods.javadoc: Return whether the project configuration has changed.
methods.name: hasChanged
methods.comment: Return whether the project configuration has changed.

methods.javadoc: Returns whether this project instance has been closed
methods.name: isClosed
methods.comment: Returns whether this project instance has been closed

methods.javadoc: Return the local tool chest for the user logged in.
methods.name: getLocalToolChest
methods.comment: Return the local tool chest for the user logged in.

methods.name: getRepository
methods.comment: Get the repository that this project is associated with.

return.comment:
null if the project is not associated with a remote
 repository

methods.name: addProjectView
methods.comment:
Add the given project URL to this project's list project views.
 The project view allows users to look at data files from another
 project.

throws.comment: if I/O error occurs or if project/repository not found

methods.javadoc:
Remove the project view from this project.
@param projectURL identifier for the project
methods.name: removeProjectView
methods.comment: Remove the project view from this project.

methods.javadoc: Return the list of project views in this project.
methods.name: getProjectViews
methods.comment: Return the list of project views in this project.

methods.javadoc: Close the project.
methods.name: close
methods.comment: Close the project.

methods.javadoc: Save the project and the list of project views.
methods.name: save
methods.comment: Save the project and the list of project views.

methods.javadoc:
Saves any tools that are associated with the opened project when the project is closed.
@return True if the save was not cancelled.
methods.name: saveSessionTools
methods.comment: Saves any tools that are associated with the opened project when the project is closed.

return.comment: True if the save was not cancelled.

methods.javadoc: Restore this project's state.
methods.name: restore
methods.comment: Restore this project's state.

methods.name: saveToolTemplate
methods.comment: Save the given tool template as part of the project.

params.name: tag
params.comment: ID or name for the tool template

methods.name: getToolTemplate
methods.comment: Get the tool template with the given tag.

params.name: tag
params.comment: ID or name for the tool template to get

methods.name: setSaveableData
methods.comment: Allows the user to store data related to the project.

params.name: key
params.comment: A value used to store and lookup saved data

params.name: saveState
params.comment: a container of data that will be written out when persisted

methods.javadoc: The analog for {@link #setSaveableData(String, SaveState)}.
methods.name: getSaveableData
methods.comment: The analog for #setSaveableData(String, SaveState).

methods.javadoc:
Get list of domain files that are open.
@return the files; empty if no files
methods.name: getOpenData
methods.comment: Get list of domain files that are open.

return.comment: the files; empty if no files

methods.javadoc: Get the root domain data folder in the project.
methods.name: getProjectData
methods.comment: Get the root domain data folder in the project.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the Project Data for the given Project locator.  The Project locator must
 be either the current active project or an currently open project view.
methods.name: getProjectData
methods.comment:
Returns the Project Data for the given Project locator.  The Project locator must
 be either the current active project or an currently open project view.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the Project Data for the given Project URL.  The Project URL must
 correspond to the current active project or an currently open project view.
methods.name: getProjectData
methods.comment:
Returns the Project Data for the given Project URL.  The Project URL must
 correspond to the current active project or an currently open project view.

methods.name: getViewedProjectData
methods.comment:
Get the project data for other projects that are
 currently being viewed.

return.comment: zero length array if there are no viewed projects open

methods.javadoc:
Releases all DomainObjects used by the given consumer
@param consumer object no longer using any DomainObjects.
methods.name: releaseFiles
methods.comment: Releases all DomainObjects used by the given consumer

params.name: consumer
params.comment: object no longer using any DomainObjects.

name: Project
comment:
Interface to define methods to manage data and tools for users working on a
 particular effort. Project represents the container object for users, data,
 and tools to work together.
